data.title: Family History Kingston upon Hull Yorkshire, East Riding 201
data.text:
Is your name TREE

last year my uncle met a couple called TREE on a coach holiday to Wales I think. I would love to meet them,as they knew my mother Doreen Price and her brother as children. They live on an East Hull housing Estate.Unfortunately they are not in the phone book. Do you know them? Larkin

William Alfred (born 1823 in Wapping) and Susannah Larkin (nee Ansell) and their children moved to Kingston Upon Hull some time around 1870 from Greenwich. He was a sawyer. His sons Alfred and George became fishermen/seamen. Alfred was lost at sea in 1888. I think George married Susannah Tucker. Another son, William Robert Alfred, also a sawyer moved to Hull with his wife Emily and family but went back to London, (Lee) in 1880. William senior and Susannah also had daughters, Louisa Ann born 1854; Susannah Louisa who married Edward Howbrigg in 1886; Ann Elizabeth born 1856. Can anyone flesh out more information about the Larkins in Hull? Bolderson / Balderson

John Bolderson (or Balderson) was born circa 1847/8 in Hull. His father was George, a farmer or farm labourer. But I can find no trace of them in the census or BMD. Can anyone give me any information please? John married Sophia Harvey nee Lain in Hull on 24 September 1872; and John was soon widowed. He remarried - Margaret Lauchlan nee Hackett. Dunn, Henry William

Henry William Dunn was convicted of theft in London, 1827. He appeared to have at least two sisters in Hull. He was transported to NSW and has many descendants in Australia. Does anyone have any idea of his antecedents in Hull? He was very naughty and didn't put any details on the usual certificates in Australia, ie marriage, death or childrens birth certificates. Will share his family tree in Australia. Best regards Rosie thomas rowntree thompson joiner

I cannot find Thomas Rowntree Thompson anywhere on census, births, marriage, deaths etc. His son Thomas Thompson _ also cannot find on Births -(occ fisherman) was born in 1868ish and married one Annie Elizabeth Betts in Hull in 1899. Thos was 31 and Annie 21 - address 37 Havelock st at the time. On the marr cert it gives his father's name as Thomas Rowntree Thompson (deceased) occ joiner. etc. Thos and Annie had 3 children, Ethel May 1902, Stan Moran 1905, and Hector 1909. At some point they ended up living in Grimsby, they were there by 1929. Thomas was lost at sea acc to family stories but I have no proof of that either. Anyone know of Thos Rowntree Thompson? Bentley family of Hull

Looking for descendants of Sam Bentley (1874-1953) who married Fanny Begal (1875-1929). Believe that one son, Israel, married Maria Marton in the 1930s. Other sons were Wolff (b.1904) and Morris (b. 1905); daughter was possibly Rachel, who married Israel Gilbert (Golberg) in 1930. Also descedants of Abraham Bentley who married Jenny Baron. Daughter Olga (b. 1926) might have married Maurice Dennison in 1947; daughter Audrey might have married John H. Franklin in 1950. There might have been other daughters, Lylla and Yetta. There was another person called Abraham Bentley who had a daughter, Ruth, in Hull at that time. These are possibly all descendants or related to Isaac and Fanny Bentley, who came to England from Poland in the 1890s. They are my great grandparents, and I am trying to trace these relatives for the family history. KENDALL-Harold wife Fanny CANNON

Seeking descendants of the above for family tree lots of information to share on the KENDALL line. Known details are as follows:- Harold KENDALL was born Abt. 1886 in Hull East Yorkshire, and died Bef. 1932. He married Fanny CANNON 23 October 1909 in Sculcoates Yorkshire. She was born Abt. 1886, and died Unknown. Children i. Alice Mary KENDALL, b. 31 July 1910, Sculcoates District 9d 123; d. April 2000, Hull district; m. Albert Henry KURRING, 24 December 1932, Sculcoates Register Office; b. Abt. 1904. ii.Muriel L. KENDALL, b. Bet. September - December 1913, Sculcoates District 9d 230; m. Walter William KURRING (brother of Albert), 12 September 1936, Drypool Church Hull East Yorkshire; b. Abt. 1909. iii. James Dennis KENDALL, b. Bet. July - September 1915, Sculcoates District 9d 174. died Nov 1996 Beverley area Yorkshire iv. Edna May KENDALL, b. Bet. September - December 1917, Sculcoates District 9d 174; m. Benjamin MARSH, 25 July 1940, Hull Register Office; b. 1911. Edward (edwin )Lee

I am trying to trace any descendants of the Lee family who possibly originated from Mirfield then moved to Hull presumably for work opportunities on the trawlers etc.My great grandfather was Edward aka Edwin Lee born around 1859 ,his father was Matthew Lee who may have married a Sarah Blissitt but not sure.Edward married Georgianna/georgina from Suffolk.One of their children was my grandfather John Lee who was born in 1910 and died at sea in 1935 when my mother was only 9 months old.I think one of Edwards children -Emma -married into the Foster family from around the sculcoates/Myton area of Hull.If anyone has any of these people in their family could they please let me know through this site. Sugar/Bentley Family

I am looking for anyone who might be a descendent of Cissie Sugar, who came to Hull around 1895 and died in 1942. I am especially looking for information about two daughters: Reizel(married name unknown) and Annie (Cook). Another daughter, Jinny, married Joe Bentley in 1906, and I'm seeking information and descendents of that Bentley family. I am Joe and Jinny Bentley's granddaughter. I am trying to write a family history. Branton

Clifford Branton - may have been baptised Frederick Clifford Branton - son of Frederick and Emma (Greenwood)Branton. Clifford died at sea (I believe off the coast of Greenland) sometime between 1918 and 1922. Any information would be welcome. It is understood his death was recorded by local newspapers, but I have had no success with finding the article or any record of his death either in the usual places or in the list of maritime deaths. ROBERT BURTON 1890.

Robert W. Burton was born at Myton, Hull in 1890. Parents ;- Robert and Emma Burton. I "believe" he married Olive E. Powley in 1916. Does anyone else have this couple in their tree? If so you may be able to help me with a long standing problem ! Look forward to hearing from someone ! Thankyou. NUNNS

I am desperately looking for further information about my great grandfather Tom Nunns. He was born c1869 and was a railway signalman. In 1889 he married Mary Jane Fell and at that time he was living in Howden. He died in Hull in 1938. The documents I hold show that his father was Thomas Nunns, a farmer. Any information gratefully received. christopher gorege rowe

im lend to belive my grandfather came from hull we cant seem to find out any information on my grandfathers family and with my dad being the last rowe in line i would like to find something out he was born late 1800 or early 1900 Thomas Leedham

Looking for information about Thomas Leedham b. 1884(son of Richard Selby Leedham b.1850) originally from Hull, who married Jessie McNeilly in Grenada West Indies about 1916. He was a Church of England clergyman.He had 3 daughters,Ruth, Grace and Nancy. He was working in Guernsey at the start of WW2 and taken prisoner when the German Army invaded. He was transferred to a POW camp in Germany (Stalag 15). After the war he went to Glasgow for a time then to Bridlington, Yorkshire, to stay with a sister. john william peach

i`m looking for information on a john william peach born 1890 was a rullyman and died before 1938......was married to a lily esther hatfield....father william peach..i havent anymore info on him would like to know his mother and how he died and if he had anymore children(only know of one)please can u help me.... Worsey family

I am looking into the family tree of the Worsey family around Hull. I have found quite a bit of information but the trail leads to Staffordshire, Hertfordshire and around the Midlands. I am not sure if the links from Hull to Stafford etc are OK but I would be interested in any information Thanks Mike Elliott, Stainton

I have some papers, photographs etc. relating to a family called Elliott. Dating from 1893 to 1980, being the death of Miss W. M. Elliott (1894-1980). Her mother was a Miss Stainton and they seem all to have been based in Hull. It would be great if the family could take possession of these papers; please get in touch. BAILEY/MOODY-Sculcoates

Thomas BAILEY of Liverpool m. Sarah Jane MOODY of Sculcoates(Hull) around 1860. They lived in Hull the rest of their lives having a plethora of boys and girls! William Henry,Thomas Wm., Frederick G., Robert, Walter G., and Sarah Ann, & Edith. The sons became self employed joiners & decorators in Hull. I have tracked William Henry who went on to have by 1901 (with wife Isabel Gertrude?) Thomas Cedric, Alice Ellaline, William Ernest & Doris Lillian. My father, age 90 and myself(childless) are the last survivors of that original Liverpool connection. Any contacts? Searby

My great (great) grandfather was John Quarton Searby, a boatman later a Customs Officer at Kingston-upon-Hull (where this family originated and was centred). With his first wife Ann Pick he had two children William Sothern Searby who became a shopkeeper (Ham and bacon) in Bridlington and married Janey/Jennie/Jeannie Mewse. They had one child Rose Ethel who married George A Bullock in Hartlepool and possibly another daughter who died aged 5. I am not sure if my paternal grandfather Joseph Harold Searby (later a shopkeeper in Anlaby Road, Hull) was the son of John Quarton or of William Sothern. Janey/Jennie died in 1893 and William remarried, probably Clara Simpson and had further children. One of them, Marjorie, married Stanley Herman Pickering in 1926. Arthur Frederick married Ellen Pratt at Grimsby, became a Hosier's Manager at Bridlington and had one son. With his second wife Mary Temperton, John Quarton Searby had 6 further children. Florence Mary Searby married Charles Fearn Craven and possibly had a son - Arthur or George. Walter Searby married Ella Eliza French and probably had a son Walter who died aged 3. Harry Searby (Grocer in Hull) married Annie Wilson. Annie Searby married William Salton. Alice Searby married Arthur Fish and had children Arthur and Norah. Hilda Searby married Cyril B Mowforth and had daughter Enid M Mowforth (born York). Any information would be appreciated as I have failed to make any connections with members of the Searby family. Elizabeth Whiteman - Merchant seaman 1888

Looking for family of my great grandfather John Henry Whiteman or Wightman b.abt.1864 Leith, son of William Henry Whiteman, a shipÂs draughtsman. John was a merchant seaman recorded on marriage to Emma Donna Esther Lyth in 1886, Kingston Upon Hull, East Yorkshire. His name was registered on marr. cert. as MacWhiteman, but may have been known as ÂMacÂ by his shipmates. He worked for the Thomas Wilson shipping line (later Ellerman Wilson line) out of Hull, and was drowned on 18.9.1888 at Elsinore, Denmark when a ship-to-shore boat from the ÂS.S. PalermoÂ capsized on launching, along with one passenger Arthur Shemeld from Northampton. ELLIOTT William born 1841

I am looking for any information about my great grandfather William Elliott born Hedon 1841 who by 1851 was in the Sculcoates Union Workhouse in Hull. I have not been able to find him on the 1861 cencus but he married Emma Fox from Welwick in 1867 in which year he also joined the police his number being 139.They had 7 children and in 1886 William became the first superintendent of the newly formed Hull City Police Fire Brigade. He had a dog called Jack who used to attend fires and when the dog died in 1893 it was buried with full firemans honours.(I would love to find out where). William was a Methodist and attended the George Yard Methodist Chapel and when he died in 1902 his funeral was filmed and shown at the Assembly Rooms - now the New Theatre. I have only seen one picture of him and he is wearing 2 medals and I wonder if he was in the Army or Navy during the years I have no trace of him.I would be grateful for any onfo or pictures - Linda McDonald Jessop

Has anyone information or recollections of Richard McDonald Jessop (1881-1943), fishmonger then fish merchant in Hull and Hessle from the early years of the twentieth century? I'd love to hear of any info. Richard's wife was Dora Ellen (nee Mann, 1883-1964); their children were Ronald McDonald Jessop, 1904-1971 ("Ron") who married Louie Tute (1906-1995); Grace Jessop 1907-1981 (became Grace Glansford on marriage) and Richard Kenneth ("Ken") Jessop 1914-1984 who was my grandfather. Many thanks, David Drant or Mcdougall research

I'm looking for any information regarding the DRANT family in Hull, My grandparents where Joseph Drant and Annie Elizabeth Mcdougall, i think they married in 1910. They lived around the sculcoates are of Hull, and i know the names of their children.. Kenneth Drant my father, and also John, Joseph (joe) Kate, Andrew, Lillian, and Annie Elizabeth (known as Liz) Any information on earlier decendents would be much appreciated. prisoners of hull

my grt grandfather john william bradshaw was a prisoner in 1891 hull census, he was a catholic,is there any way in which i could find out the offence he committed and how long he served in prison thank you Stubbins

Looking for anyone with a George (b. 1871) Stubbins who was married to a Martha Swaby who died in 1911. They would have been my great-great grandparents. If you have them in your family tree please contact/share information ?? Also family name of Sherman from Hull, parishes were Sculcoats and Holy Trinity. Hull, Cheshire, Lincolnshire

I am about to print a family history for family use only, but if anyone can show they have a link to my charts I may be able to send them a copy. The surnames are shown below, one (Corbett) having come from Birmingham but several from Cheshire and Lincolnshire, though all names have a beginning or move into East Yorkshire, including Hull. Beck, Beharell, Corbett, Grainger, Hammond, Holdsworth, Huntsman, Jones, Kingston, May, Ogdon, Roberts, Staveley, Storey and Waudby. Horton

I am looking for ancestors of John and Rebecca (Milner) Horton both born in 1811? He in Hull and she in Bridlington. He is believed to have been a tailor by trade. They apparently had 4 children before coming to the United Sates in 1850. Their names are Charles, Sara, David and Thomas. They moved to Eden Prairie Minnesota in 1850
